required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transoral Removal of Specimen During Laparoscopic Gastric Resection
clinical_study.official_title: Transoral Removal of Specimen During Laparoscopic Gastric Resection

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators aimed to present the patients who underwent laparoscopic gastrectomy with transoral specimen extraction.

detailed_description.textblock: Minimally invasive surgical procedures such as NOSE (Natural orifice spesmen extraction) and NOTES (Natural orifice translumenal endoscopic surgery) are gradually increasing. The transoral way is probably the least used for NOSE.

primary_outcome.measure: Transoral Specimen Extraction During Laparoscopic Gastric Resection
primary_outcome.description: laparoscopic gastric resections due to sleeve gastrectomy or pyloric obstruction will be observed after transoral removal.

intervention.description: transoral specimen extraction during laparoscopic gastric resection

study_pop.textblock: patients who underwent sleeve gastrectomy for morbid obesity, subtotal gastrectomy for pyloric obstruction, and extensive gastric resection for gastrointestinal stromac tumor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- laparoscopic gastric resection
- Patients aged 18-70 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- other transorally removed organs (appendix, gallbladder, surrenal)

patient_data.ipd_description: The patients who underwent laparoscopic gastric resection with transoral extraction between 2014-2018 in Inonu University gastroenterology surgery clinic will be evaluated retrospectively. Patients will be evaluated in terms of age, sex, indication for surgery, operation, number and diameter of ports used, duration of surgery, intraoperative and postoperative complications, duration of hospitalization.
